column1: BM_HUNGARY_DESC;The death of the Ilyena Árpád
column2: the childless Queen of Croatia
column3: passes her Kingdom on to her brother László
column4: King of Hungary. The union of Hungary-Croatia brings strength to the Magyars
column5: but will László and this new-formed Baltic union be able to stand the test of time? Elsewhere in the world
column6: Yusuf Almoravid
column7: Sultan of Mauretania
column8: has begun uniting the peoples of North Africa and southern Iberia. He seeks to contest--and if possible
column9: reverse--the conquests that the kingdom of León-Castille has managed against the Muslims of Iberia.;;;;;;;;;x

column1: BM_THE_ISLES;King of Dublin and the Isles;;;;;;;;;x

column2: of both Norwegian and Irish descent
column3: has finally succeeded in expanding his Kingdom of Mann and the Isles to include his birthright
column4: the Kingdom of Dublin. The day of the Norwegian conquerors is over
column5: dead with the failure of Harald Hårdråde at Stamford Bridge
column6: but Gudrød Crovan believes in turning back that clock. From his foothold in Dublin
column7: he seeks to expand and name himself Ard Rí ua Éire
column8: High King of Ireland. But Gudrod is not without other troubles. He holds lands that Malcolm Dunkeld calls his own
column9: and the Scottish king will not back down from his own birthright easily.;;;;;;;;;x

column1: BM_NORWAY_1_DESC;The Kingdom that Gudrød Crovan worked his entire life to create is no more. Dead of the plague
column2: Gudrød's Kingdom has fractured. While King Magnus III of Norway has reasserted hegemony over much of Gudrød's old land
column3: Galloway and Dublin have both declared independence from the Norwegian King. The north of Albion lies in flux: will Magnus be able to avenge his defeated grandfather the Hårdråde and terrorise the shores of Albion once again
column4: or will Edgar
column5: the young King of Scotland
column6: be able to use this transition to his advantage?;;;;;;;;;x

column1: BM_EDGE_OF_KNIFE_DESC;The Western World stands upon the edge of a knife. In Iberia
column2: the Almoravid Sultanate is nearing total victory
column3: with Alfonso of León-Castilla barely holding on to the north of España
column4: and the Kingdom of Aragón-Navarra and the Duchy of Barcelona barely surviving at the French border. Across the Mediterranean
column5: although the Komnenoi have taken the throne and fight valiantly against the Turk
column6: Sultan Kilij Arslan holds much of Anatolia under his grasp
column7: and looks with greedy eyes toward the independent Duchy of Armenia Minor. Iberia or Anatolia
column8: Castille or Byzantium: will the heathens succeed in breaking the iron walls of Christianity to finally breech the interior of Europe?;;;;;;;;;x

column1: BM_ANTIOCH_DESC;The Levant reels in the aftermath of the bloody conflict that is the First Crusade. In the north
column2: the Principalities of Antioch and Edessa vie for superiority
column3: both against the Muslims and each other. The Prince of Antioch
column4: Bohemond
column5: is in constant contention with Thoros
column6: the Orthodox Duke of Armenia Minor
column7: whose lands he has usurped. To the south
column8: the infant Kingdom of Jerusalem is balanced against the weakened Fatimid Caliphate
column10: and myriad minor sheikhs dividing it from the Princes to the north. Can the Catholics hold out long enough to unify
column11: or must another Crusade be called to secure a Catholic Holy Land?;;;;;;;;;x

column1: BM_JERUSALEM_DESC;Jerusalem stands strong and proud. The Principality of Antioch has been absorbed and the Kingdom has expanded inland
column2: toward the Sinai peninsula and Damascus. Although Jerusalem's size and strength goes a long way to secure Catholic dominance in the Levant
column3: everything is far from guaranteed. Damascus and Aleppo still stand as guards against the massive Seljuk Sultanate to the East
column4: and the Fatimid Caliph smarts over the losses Egypt suffered during the First Crusade. Jerusalem has many enemies
column5: and few friends. In the distance
column6: a scream for Jihad sounds....;;;;;;;;;x

column2: and Hungary looks on in fear. Ever the opportunist
column3: Manuel had long ago concluded a pact with the King of Hungary
column4: István III
column5: whereby István's brother Belá would be educated at the Imperial court in Constantinople. Manuel had as-of-yet been without legitimate male issue
column6: and intended Belá to be married to his daughter Maria
column7: to eventually rule alongside her as Emperor.  Sensing opportunity
column9: Manuel decided to move against István and press his son-in-law's claims on the duchies of Dalmatia and Croatia. With those titles secured
column10: Belá is now a landed vassal of Manuel
column11: and the heir to the Kingdoms of Croatia and Hungary. Although the Komnenos line looks as though it may slip from the Imperial seat unless Manuel takes immediate action
column12: the Byzantine Empire stands to grasp the greatest prize it has had in its sights since the Komnenoi took the throne: the buffer between the Holy Roman and Eastern Roman Empires.;;;;;;;;;x

column1: BM_SERBIA_DESC;The Komnenoi have fallen from the Imperial Throne
column2: and Byzantium is falling with them. The newly-formed Kingdoms of Serbia and Bulgaria have declared their independence from the Byzantine crown
column3: the Seljuk Sultans of Rum press against the Empire's restored borders in Anatolia
column4: and an independent Belá III rules in Hungary-Croatia. All of Manuel Komnenos's dreams have come to naught
column5: but this is a time of opportunity
column6: for those wise enough to see it. Alexios Komnenos
column7: an infant member of the royal Komnenos dynasty
column8: rules in Trebizond. If he can gather support enough to press his claim on Byzantium
column9: the young Komnenos can work to restore the golden age his family's untimely fall from grace brought to a close.;;;;;;;;;x

column1: BM_IBERIA_DESC;Iberia is balanced between the Muslims and Christians. In the north the Catholics divide the land between five Kingdoms: Portugal
column2: León
column3: Castille
column4: Navarra
column5: and Aragón. To the south
column6: the Muslims are unified under the powerful Almohad Sultanate. Is this a time of opportunity and growth for the Christians
column7: or has the Almohad Sultan amassed enough power to finally breach Europe proper?;;;;;;;;;x

column1: BM_TURMOIL_IN_THE_EAST_DESC;The Fourth Crusade has left Byzantium crippled
column2: and its prior vassal states do not fare much better. Three powerful Dukes vie for control of Greece proper
column3: and only one of them are Greek. The hatred between the Latin and Byzantine Empires has not abated
column4: but neither has progress been made toward discovering the final victor in their struggle. Glory and titles are there
column5: for a man--or woman--strong enough to seize them.;;;;;;;;;x

column1: BM_FRACTURE_DESC;Plagued by the Mongols to the east and decadence within itself
column2: the Sultanate of Rûm has collapsed. In its place a half-dozen Sultans have risen
column3: all claiming to be Rûm's true successor. The Byzantine Empire
column4: labored and barely standing
column5: has recovered Constantinople
column6: but its strength to do more than that is in question. Many other lords and lands have interest in the east
column7: not to mention Naples and the still-warring Dukes in Greece
column8: but regardless of if it is desired
column9: this is one man's time. A great nation must rise from the ashes of Rûm--or Byzantium--and whoever succeeds in unifying the disparate peoples of the Aegean shall have power enough to challenge the gateguard of Europe

column2: by election King of Sweden and by birthright King of Norway
column3: has temporarily united much of Scandinavia under his rule. Unless Magnus proves to be an exceptional King it is unlikely that the union will live beyond him
column4: but there are those who whisper of an Empire of the North
column5: with Magnus I at its head….;;;;;;;;;x

column1: BM_ITALY_DESC;The Holy Roman Empire is in decline
column2: and Italy has finally been completely freed from its grasp. Dukes war with counts
column3: mayors with Doges. Who will unite Italy--or will Italy be united at all?;;;;;;;;;x

column1: BM_SALADIN_DESC;Salah ad-Din Yusuf ibn Ayyub--better known to the Western world as Saladin--has taken the throne of Egypt for his own. Previously the servant of the Emir of Damascus
column2: Nur ad-Din
column3: Salah ad-Din has broken with his former benefactor to usurp the Sultanate of Egypt from the Shia Fatimids during a period of crisis
column4: choosing opportunity over longstanding friendship with the Emir
column5: and causing great tension in the Crusader States. Although Salah ad-Din is likely to be preoccupied for a time with the Emir of Aleppo
column6: not to mention his own Shia subjects
column7: it is only a matter of time until the holy warrior turns his eyes toward the states of Jerusalem and Antioch….;;;;;;;;;x

column1: BM_ANARCHY_DESC;The Anarchy was a period of early English history in which the dynasty of the Norman conqueror William broke down and was replaced by the cadet house of Plantagenet. It began when the second Norman King of England
column2: Henry I
column3: died without legitimate issue. Although Henry attempted to place his daughter Matilda on the throne
column4: the lords of England would not have it. In his daughter's place
column5: a male descendent of William through the female line
column6: Stephen de Blois
column7: was declared king. Support for Stephen was not absolute
column9: and there were many loyalists who sided with Matilda in the succession. Matilda herself was married to the first son of King Foulque of Jerusalem
column11: later to be known as Geoffrey Plantagenet. Geoffrey has managed to conquer Normandy in her name
column12: and the succession crisis between the powerful vassal and the weak King Stephen of England appears to be inevitable.;;;;;;;;;x

column1: BM_LITHUANIA_DESC;After the brief reign of the usurper-king Treniotas
column2: the people of Lithuania have seen fit to restore the house of King Mindaugas to the throne
column3: establishing his first son Vaisvilkas as King. Vaisvilkas has expanded Lithuania to the east
column4: and in so doing has inadvertantly made Lithuania one of the de facto gateguards of Europe alongside the Kings of Poland
column5: Hungary
column6: Bulgaria
column7: and the Grand Duke of Novgorod. Although Vaisvilkas's realm is still relatively small
column8: his pious Christianity buys him time and potential support from other Christian rulers.  If he can gain that support and use it to hold off the Mongol horde
column9: the ambitious young King of Lithuania might well be able to recover some of his ancestral lands lost to the Teuton knights….;;;;;;;;;x

column2: current Holy Roman Emperor
column3: has put down Ottokar II of Bohemia
column4: his only rival for the Imperial throne. With Ottokar's defeat much of his lands have defaulted back to the crown
column5: including the duchy of Österreich
column6: which Rudolf has entrusted to his son
column7: Albricht. Although the succession is secure and a new age has begun with the Habsburg control of Österreich
column8: not all is well in the Empire. The Kingdom of Sicily has broken out of the firm control that Frederick II held it with
column10: conquering much of the coast of Greece and even the Duchy of Provence. Inspired by the succession crisis and Sicily's success
column11: many small states of northern Italy have declared independence. History calls the Habsburgs one of the most successful houses of the Medieval period
column12: but now they face the potential collapse of the Empire's control of the Italian peninsula. Stop the collapse
column13: for the glory of the House of Habsburg!;;;;;;;;;x

column2: through bribes to the German electorate
column3: has been elected as King of the Germans. His election is not a simple one
column4: however. It raises serious questions about the future of the Holy Roman Empire. The powerful Plantagenet England is a strong ally of the Emperor--one that he may need
column5: for the Holy Roman Empire is dangerously imbalanced. Konrad II von Hohenstauffen
column6: King of Sicily and grandson to Frederick Barbarossa
column7: is an independent elector of the Empire
column8: and jealously seeking a return of his family's titles. His control of the Duchy of Swabia means the Kingdom of Sicily has lands in central Germany
column9: weakening the Empire and making Konrad a valid successor. If danger from outside Kings is not enough
column10: Ottokar II of Bohemia has expanded toward the Adriatic sea
column11: massing power and support for his own potential election. Can the House of Plantagenet maintain control through another election?;;;;;;;;;x

column1: BM_CASTILLE;The Union of Castille and León;;;;;;;;;x
BM_CASTILLE_DESC;Through the untimely death of his brothers
column2: Sancho of Castille has come to inherit his family's divided kingdoms of Galicia and León. Although the crown of Galicia has been declared defunct
column3: Sancho has chosen to retain León and rule it in personal union alongside Castille
column4: crowning himself the Emperor of León-Castilla. With northern Iberia united against the Islamic threat to the south there is greater hope for a Catholic peninsula than before
column5: but nothing is certain. Personal unions can be broken
column6: and Muslims can unite against a common threat just as their Catholic brethren have.;;;;;;;;;x

column1: BM_LEVANT_DESC;Against even other Muslims the Seljuk horde does not stay its hand. Seeking access to critical Mediterranean trade and control over the holy city of Mecca
column2: Malik I Shah of the Seljuk Sultanate has declared war upon the Fatimid Sultan al-Mustansir
column3: a war that al-Mustansir has lost. Control of the Levant and the holy cities of Mecca and Medina have passed into Seljuk hands
column4: smashing the balance of power in the east and making the Seljuks one of the most powerful states in Eurasia.;;;;;;;;;x

column2: the duchies of Kiev and Novgorod stand balanced in the frigid north of Russia. Both are powerful and both wish to unite the Rus in a more permanent union
column3: but only one can succeed. To the south
column4: problems in Byzantium are alleviated by the fracture of the Seljuk royal house between the seat of Perisa and Rum
column5: but this
column6: too
column7: is an imperfect solution--the Sultanate of Rum is still immensely powerful. Nevertheless
column8: with the immediate pressure of the immensely powerful Seljuk Sultanate diverted from Byzantine possessions
column9: it may be possible to take advantage of the weakened position of the Egyptian Sultan on the North African coast….;;;;;;;;;x

column1: BM_ALMORAVID_DESC;The ascension of a young boy to the throne of the Almoravid Sultanate in the west has caused a domino effect of rebellions in its Iberian territories
column2: while the Seljuk Sultanate's decadent collapse
column3: accelerated by the Kingdom of Jerusalem battering at its borders
column4: weakens Islam's unity in the east. Now is the time
column5: servants of Christendom
column6: to take up joyous arms in the name of Christ!;;;;;;;;;x

column2: beset on all sides with enemies and divided internally by decadence
column3: corruption
column4: and incompetence
column5: has finally collapsed. Myriad ex-vassals
column6: remaining members of the Seljuk family
column7: and opportunists stand poised to fight over the remnants. The Sunni Caliph
column10: some of them the last remnants of the old Persian elite
column11: all circle the corpse with hunger--who will win the great prize?;;;;;;;;;x

column1: BM_SICILY_DESC;Richard the Lionheart and Philippe II Auguste stare daggers at one another across the Channel. Through inheritance
column2: bribery
column3: betrayal
column4: and timely conquest the kings of England have been able to occupy well over half of the lands claimed by the French kings
column5: and stand dangerously close to claiming the French crown. Philippe II
column6: known to history as Auguste (Augustus or 'the August')
column7: the monarch that reversed the English conquests and restored French unity and prestige
column8: seems to be in an impossible position--can you replicate his incredible feats? Elsewhere in the world
column9: the Emperor of the Holy Roman Empire has claimed the Kingdom of Sicily as his dynastic birthright.;;;;;;;;;x

column2: one of the last remaining members of the Komnenos dynasty
column3: now reigns in his majority in Trebizond. Alexios shares the determination and skill common in his family
column4: and has managed not only to hold Trebizond together in the face of Muslim aggression
column5: but to expand his territory and crown himself Despot. He has not forgotten his claim to the Byzantine Empire
column6: nor has he forgotten his dynasty's golden age upon the throne
column7: lost now to Imperial incompetence and the shameful Fourth Crusade… but perhaps not lost forever. Now is the time for the Komnenoi to reclaim their titles
column9: their birthright. Now is the time for the return of the rightful Emperors!;;;;;;;;;x

column1: BM_ANUSHTIGINID_DESC;The Anushtiginid Sultanate has finally restored a degree of order to Persia by uniting it in as complete a political union as the land has seen since the collapse of the Seljuk Sultanate over 50 years before. Despite great success
column2: the path to glory is not certain for the Anushtiginids. Discontented vassals
column3: and curious rumors of riders to the east are enough to keep any wise Sultan awake through the long nights.;;;;;;;;;x

column1: BM_MALI_DESC;The lands that would come to be known as the Empire of Mali have been united under its first Mansa. What this means for the future
column2: and for the safety of the Mauretanian Sultan's southern border
column3: remains to be seen.;;;;;;;;;x

column1: BM_NAPLES_DESC;In the bloody aftermath of the Sicilian Vespers
column2: a war in which the Aragonese King attempted to assert his claim to the Kingdom of Sicily
column3: the southern Italian peninsula is divided. The Kingdom of Trinacria has been proclaimed on the island of Sicily
column4: with the brother of the Aragonese King ruling
column5: and claiming rights to the entirety of the kingdom. On the mainland
column6: the old king of Sicily
column7: now absent his title's namesake
column8: has instead crowned himself the King of Naples
column9: and looks with jealousy on the island that should by rights be his. Both sides of the conflict have powerful allies
column10: the king of Trinacria protected by the Kings of Aragon and Castille
column11: and the king of Naples supported by Hungary-Croatia--a new war will noy be an easy one. Also on the Iberian peninsula
column12: Philippe IV Capet has come to inherit the Kingdom of Navarra
column13: and can likewise be counted in the Iberian struggle. Who will move when
column14: and what will they move against?;;;;;;;;;x

column1: BM_ILKHANATE_DESC;The Ilkhanate's Khan has converted to Shia Islam!;;;;;;;;;x
BM_POLAND_DESC;Due to the untimely death of the Polish monarch without a favorable heir
column2: Vaclav II Premyslid of Bohemia has been crowned king in place of another Piast. This gives Vaclav--heir to Ottokar
column3: and all the desire for revenge against the von Hohenstauffens that comes with being his son--a great deal of power in Europe. If Vaclav is given time to consolidate and expand it is unlikely the Holy Roman Empire will ever be able to reassert its authority over Bohemia
column4: with its control of the Italian peninsula already crumbling. The time to move is now!;;;;;;;;;x

column1: BM_GH_DESC;The Khan of the Golden Horde has converted to Sunni Islam!;;;;;;;;;x
BM_LITHUANIA_FORMED_DESC;With the Teutonic Order occupying their historic lands in the West and the Golden Horde destroying the Rurikovich to the East
column2: the myriad tribes of Lithuania have finally seen fit to unite under one king for their better protection
column3: by necessity. Mindaugas I is a strong ruler
column4: but his kingdom is not. Lacking many of his historic lands
column5: those having been usurped by the Teutonic Order
column6: and being only a few petty duchies away from a full border with the Golden Horde
column7: his fitness will be tested in the coming days. Not only does Lithuania have a vassalage of mixed religions
column9: Mindaugas's own children are divided in their worship even from his own faith
column10: with his son and heir Vaisvilkas an Orthodox Christian and his second son Daumantas a Romuvan. To secure his lands and carve a future for the Lithuanian people
column11: Mindaugas must calm the religious tension in his realm while seeking alliances to help him in recovering his people's ancestral land. For Lietuva!;;;;;;;;;x

column1: BM_MONGOL_SPLIT_DESC;Following the death of the great Khan Ghengis
column2: his realm has split between his heirs. His grandson Batu rules in the north as the Golden Horde
column3: while his youngest son Tolui rules in the south as the Ilkhanate. Although the division of these realms may well make the Mongol menace weaker on the offensive
column4: their dynastic alliance will certainly make what lands they have already claimed nigh-impenetrable….;;;;;;;;;x

column1: BM_TWO_ERIKS;The War of the Two Eriks;;;;;;;;;x
BM_TWO_ERIKS_DESC;On the death of King Stenkil I
column2: his son Erik ascended the throne of Sweden as Erik II. As soon as the young Erik II ascended the throne
column3: Erik III of Uppland declared a war to place himself
column4: youngest--and bastard--son of King Emundr I
column5: on the throne in a conflict which would come to be known as the War of the Two Eriks. Erik II is Catholic
column6: whereas Erik III is Norse
column7: one of the last living remnants of the old faith. Can Erik III restore the Norse religion and the rule of his house to a land that has abandoned both?;;;;;;;;;x

column1: BM_SARTAQ_KHAN_DESC;Sartaq Khan has become Khagan of the Golden Horde
column2: but his reign is unstable and almost certainly doomed to fail. Sartaq is a Nestorian Christian
column3: a heathen to his fellow Mongols and a heretic to his Orthodox vassals. There is minimal support for his reign throughout the Golden Horde… but perhaps there need not be. Realms that have been battered by warfare
column4: either by the Horde itself or other Muslims
column5: will inevitably look toward Sartaq's ascension--heretic or not--as a beacon in a time of darkness. If Sartaq can retain his rule long enough to form marriage ties with strong European realms
column6: his rule and his faith might be beaten into his reluctant vassals.;;;;;;;;;x
